member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Schedule.C1Calendar
member.summary: The control is a fully functional Outlook-style calendar that enables end-users to select the current date or the set of dates to navigate through the control. Depending on the amount of space available, the control can display one or more months at a time.
member.remarks: A functional scheduling application can be created without using the control, but the provides visual navigational capabilities.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Schedule.C1Schedule
member.summary: The control is a fully functional Outlook-style schedule that allows users to add, edit, and manage their appointments by loading all of the appointment data either from a bound DataSource or the built-in DataSource, which saves and loads data from binary, XML or iCal file formats. By default, the control will display the appointment data in the mode, and the current day is the first date displayed.

member.summary: Gets the selected object or returns null if the selection is empty.

member.summary: Gets or sets the value determining the maximum number of the objects displayed in UI at the same time. Increasing this value might affect performance.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Schedule.C1Schedule.GroupBy
member.summary: Gets or sets the value determining the type of grouping.
member.value: The default value is an empty string.

remarks.para:
This property can be equal to one for the next supported keywords:
An empty stringno grouping.
"Owner"grouping by Appointment.Owner property value.
"Category"grouping by Appointment.Categories property value.
"Contact"grouping by Appointment.Links property value.
"Resource"grouping by Appointment.Resources property value.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Schedule.C1Schedule.ShowEmptyGroupItem
member.summary: Gets or sets the value determining whether the control should display an empty group item.
member.remarks: This property only makes sense when the property is set. If this property is set to True, the control will display a group item without assigned owner (resource, contact or category). This group item will contain all appointments, which don't fall into other group items.

member.summary: Determines auxiliary properties providing different object settings.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Schedule.C1ScheduleSettings.AllowContactsEditing
member.summary: Determines whether end-user has permission to edit Contacts.
member.remarks: If this property is false, default dialogs will only allow selection from the existing items. If this property is false and ContactCollection is empty, default Appointment dialog won't show controls for editing Contacts.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Schedule.C1ScheduleSettings.AllowContactsMultiSelection
member.summary: Determines whether multiple Contact objects might be assigned to the single Appointment object.

remarks.para: If both and properties are false, the default Appointment dialog will show ComboBox for selecting single Contact object.
If this property is true, the default Appointment dialog will allow selecting multiple contacts in a separate dialog.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Schedule.C1ScheduleSettings.AllowResourcesEditing
member.summary: Determines whether end-user has permission to edit Resources.
member.remarks: If this property is false, default dialogs will only allow selection from the existing items. If this property is false and ResourceCollection is empty, default Appointment dialog won't show controls for editing Resources.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Schedule.C1ScheduleSettings.AllowResourcesMultiSelection
member.summary: Determines whether multiple Resource objects might be assigned to the single Appointment object.

remarks.para: If both and properties are false, the default Appointment dialog will show ComboBox for selecting single Resource object.
If this property is true, the default Appointment dialog will allow selecting multiple resources in a separate dialog.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Schedule.C1ScheduleSettings.AllowCategoriesEditing
member.summary: Determines whether end-user has permission to edit Categories.
member.remarks: If this property is false, default dialogs will only allow selection from the existing items. If this property is false and CategoryCollection is empty, default Appointment dialog won't show controls for editing Categories.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Schedule.C1ScheduleSettings.AllowCategoriesMultiSelection
member.summary: Determines whether multiple Category objects might be assigned to the single Appointment object.

remarks.para: If both and properties are false, the default Appointment dialog will show ComboBox for selecting single Category object.
If this property is true, the default Appointment dialog will allow selecting multiple categories in a separate dialog.

component uses this collection to switch currently used palettes or to show multiple schedules at the same time.

member.summary: Returns object for the property. If the storage object is bound to a data source via its DataSource property, the properties of this object allow the property to be bound to the appropriate field in the data source.
member.remarks: Each object derived from is identified by either Id or Index property. To allow data to be correctly restored from your data sources you should specify mapping either for the or for the . It makes sense in case if you bind to your data storages of Resources, Labels, Contacts or Categories. C1Schedule saves only Ids or Indexes of these objects in AppointmentSorage. If there is no mapping for IdMapping or IndexMapping, C1Schedule won't be able to identify Appointment's properties correctly in storages initialized by your data.

member.summary: The component handles all data operations for the scheduler control and contains specific data storages for appointments, resources, contacts, owners, labels and statuses, which are used for binding different collections to the data. This property is serialized into different formats and it is saved into underlying data source if mapping for Appointment Properties is set.

member.summary: Gets or sets custom text value associated with this object.

member.summary: Gets or sets the value representing the body of the object.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Conflicts
member.summary: Gets the object representing the list of objects which are in conflict with this particular appointment.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.AutoResolvedWinner
member.summary: Gets the value determining if the item is a winner of an automatic conflict resolution.
member.remarks: A value of false does not necessarily indicate that the item is a loser of an automatic conflict resolution. The item should be in conflict with another item. If an item has its Conflicts.Count property greater than zero and if its property is true, it is a winner of an automatic conflict resolution. On the other hand, if the item is in conflict and has its property as false, it is a loser in an automatic conflict resolution.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Start
member.summary: Gets or sets the value determining the start date and time of the appointment.

remarks.para: If the property is set to true, then the start date of the appointment is the of the , and the start time of the appointment is 0:00.
At setting this property, if it's time is not equal 0:00, the property will be set to false.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.End
member.summary: Gets or sets the value determining the end date and time of the appointment.

remarks.para: The property is usually specified by the and properties, and is always calculated as = + . When setting the property, the property retains its value, and the is changed according to the new value of the property. If the new property's value is less than the property's value, then an exception will be raised.
At setting this property, if it's time is not equal 0:00, or value is equal to the value of property, the property will be set to false.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.IsOneDay
member.summary: Gets a value indicating either it is a one day appointment or shares some days.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the duration of the appointment.
member.remarks: At setting this property, if it's value is not equal to the whole number of days, the property will be set to false.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Location
member.summary: Gets or sets the value specifying where the appointment is going to be.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.ReminderSet
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether a reminder is associated with the appointment. Once this property is set to true, a new object is created and assigned to the property.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.ReminderTimeBeforeStart

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.ReminderOverrideDefault
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating if the associated object has non-default settings. True if the reminder overrides the default reminder behavior for the appointment. You must set the property to validate the and the properties.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.ReminderPlaySound
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating if the reminder should play a sound when it occurs for this appointment or task. The property must be set in order to validate the property. This property is only valid if the property is set to true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.ReminderSoundFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the path and file name of the sound file to play when the reminder occurs for the appointment. This property is only valid if the and properties are set to true.
member.remarks: The default sound is the system Exclamation sound.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.IsRecurring
member.summary: Gets the value indicating if the appointment is recurring.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.ParentRecurrence
member.summary: Gets the object that defines the recurrence criteria for this object. If this appointment is a not member of a recurrence, or is itself a root appointment, null is returned.
member.remarks: If an appointment is recurring (see the property) it represents an occurrence in the series that is started and defined by a specific pattern appointment. Use the property to obtain the pattern of the current appointment. A pattern appointment can be recognized by its property set to the value. The recurrence information defined by the pattern appointment can be accessed via the property of the appointment.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.RecurrenceState

member.summary: Prevents the object from being updated until the method is called.
member.remarks: The and methods are designed to implement batch modifications. This allows you to prevent generation of change notifications when changing multiple settings at the same time. To do this enclose the code that changes the properties in calls to these methods. Each call to must be paired with a call to . To ensure that is always called even if an exception occurs, wrap any calls to these methods in a try...finally statement.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.RecurrenceType
member.summary: Gets or sets the value determining the type of recurrence (daily, monthly, etc.). Default value is RecurrenceTypeEnum.Weekly.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.Interval
member.summary: Gets or sets the value specifying the interval between occurrences of the recurrence. The property works in conjunction with the property to determine the cycle of the recurrence. The maximum allowable value is 99 for weekly patterns and 999 for daily patterns. The default value is 1.
member.remarks: For example, if the is set to , and the is set to 3, the recurrence will occur every third day.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.EndTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the end time for the given occurrence of the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.StartTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the start time for the given occurrence of the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the duration of each occurrence in the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.PatternStartDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the start date of the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.PatternEndDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the end date of the recurrence pattern.
member.remarks: This property is optional but must be coordinated with other properties when setting up a recurrence pattern. If this property or the property is set, the pattern is considered to be finite, and the property is false. If neither nor is set, the pattern is considered infinite and is true. The property must be set before setting .

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.Occurrences
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of occurrences for the recurrence pattern. This property allows the definition of a recurrence pattern that is only valid for the specified number of subsequent occurrences. For example, you can set this property to 10 for a formal training course that will be held on the next ten Thursday evenings. The default value is 0.
member.remarks: This property must be coordinated with other properties when setting up a recurrence pattern. If the property or the property is set, the pattern is considered to be finite and the property is false. If neither nor is set, the pattern is considered infinite and is true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.Instance
member.summary: Get or sets the value specifying the count for which the recurrence pattern is valid for a given interval. This property is only valid for recurrences of the and types and allows the definition of a recurrence pattern that is only valid for the Nth occurrence, such as "the 2nd Sunday in March" pattern. The default value is WeekOfMonthEnum.First.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.DayOfWeekMask
member.summary: Gets or sets the value representing the mask for week days on which the recurring appointment occurs. Monthly and yearly patterns are only valid for a single day. Weekly patterns are only valid as the Or of the . The default value is 0.
member.remarks: When the property is set to , the property can only be set to ; setting the property to any other value will result in an exception. When the property is set to , the property can only be set to ; setting the property to any other value will result in an exception. When the property is set to , the property cannot be set to ; doing so will result in an exception being thrown. When the property is set to or the property is not applicable.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.DayOfMonth
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of the day in its respective month on which each occurrence will occur. Applicable only when the property is set to or . The default value is 1.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.MonthOfYear
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating which month of the year is valid for the specified recurrence pattern. Can be a number from 1 to 12. This property is only valid for recurrence patterns whose property is set to or . The default value is 1.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.NoEndDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating if the recurrence pattern is endless. The default value is True.
member.remarks: This property must be coordinated with other properties when setting up a recurrence pattern. If the property or the property is set, the pattern is considered to be finite and the property is false. If neither nor is set, the pattern is considered infinite and is true.
